<RESUME_START>
INDUSTRIAL ENGINEERING INTERN

SUMMARY

Seeking for full time position where I can apply my technical knowledge & skills for continuous improvement.
I have 26 months of experience in Lean Manufacturing, Production Planning and Supply Chain Management.
Excellent computer and analytical skills.
Highlights
Application Software: MS Office, Minitab, PowerPoint, Excel, Solid works, AutoCAD, Pro E Database: MS Access, SAP
Programming: Java, C, C++, Visual Basic, R, Python

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Quality Control: Implementing of PDCA cycle for improving image quality of smartphone camera, implementing DMAIC cycle for improving quality issues related to cosmetic damages (scratches, bent, dent, etc.) using control charts and z transformation.
Metrics & Measurements: Time study, Process Mapping, JIT, &Work Sampling of Activities.
Intro to Statistics: Data analysis using normal & exponential distribution, simple & multi linear Regression.
Project Management: Project planning, analysis, scheduling using CPM and PERT analysis.
Production & Inventory Control: Develop assembly chart, process flow layout for subway with JIT.
Facility Planning: Designing and planning picking process, rack arrangement, Shipping and receiving locations.
Planning all warehouse process by analyzing previous order quantity records.
Developing new process in warehouse for maximum utilization of assets and meet required shipping demand during peek session.
Underwater Robot: Worked at IIT-Bombay workshop to make an underwater robot.
The robot was assembled using sensors, switches and motors for maneuvering the robot.
Technical Papers Inventory Management and Risk Pooling: Presented how centralized and decentralized distribution system affects safety stock, service level, overhead cost, customer lead time and transportation cost.
Single Minute Exchange of Die concept: Explained how changeovers are not bad and how change over times could be reduced if the changeover process is mapped.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Manfacturing Engineer Intern - Electronics

Location: Glendale Heights, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Manufacturing/Process Engineer Intern
About usSurya Electronics is a rapidly growing, PC Board Contract Assembly business in Glendale Heights, IL. Established in 1983, we are professional, customer-centric, and fast-paced and our goal is to pay fairly for hard working, intelligent individuals in a rewarding and friendly environment. We are minority owned and focused on developing the next generation. 
Our work environment includes:Casual work attireOn-the-job trainingSafe work environmentWe are looking for a Manufacturing Engineering or Electrical Engineering Intern to work closely with Senior Engineering to develop the product engineering files, design for manufacture, and create work processes and instructions. As part of the training, a candidate will develop skills to review and approve assembly files, customer designs, develop work instructions to meet ISO 9001:2015 standards and source purchased components. The candidate will also gain experience with customer service, supplier selection, and operations. 
We are looking for a motivated, enthusiastic and flexible person to join our team, with a mind for Continuous Improvement. The candidate should have a good eye for detail, and have good organizational skills. The successful candidate will have the ability to work independently and efficiently, as well as the ability to follow instructions closely.   Daily Responsibilities:Assist Senior Engineers with the design review and release of customer designs;Develop BOM’s and verify component availability; Identify alternative components and suppliers; Create work instructions;Complete Continuous Improvement Projects;Data Entry into the ERP software;Coach operators on proper manufacturing processes and techniques.Additional Responsibilities:Participate in Lean and QMS improvement committees; Participate and potentially lead 5S and work station layout projectsData EntryDesired Experience and Skills:Degree path towards a degree in computer science, electrical engineering or engineering technology, electronics technology or circuit design;Experience with Circuits; Microsoft Office proficiency. (Requirement);General computer literacy; Demonstrable problem solving skills; The ideal candidate will be curious, flexible, creative and team orientated. Job Type: Flexible, on site (20 to 40 hours)Working Hours: 7:00 AM - 3:30 PMSalary: $16.50 / Hour
Ability to commute/relocate:Glendale Heights, IL 60139: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Language:English (Required)Work Location: In person

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
